2.text: Whose helper art thou? is it of him that is weak? and dost thou hold up the arm of him that has no strength?

3.text: To whom hast thou given counsel? perhaps to him that hath no wisdom, and thou hast shewn thy very great prudence.

4.text: Whom hast thou desired to teach? was it not him that made life?

5.text: Behold the giants groan under the waters, and they that dwell with them.

6.text: Hell is naked before him, and there is no covering for destruction.

7.text: He stretched out the north over the empty space, and hangeth the earth upon nothing.

8.text: He bindeth up the waters in his clouds, so that they break not out and fall down together.

9.text: He withholdeth the face of his throne, and spreadeth his cloud over it.

10.text: He hath set bounds about the waters, till light and darkness come to an end.

11.text: The pillars of heaven tremble, and dread at his beck.

12.text: By his power the seas are suddenly gathered together, and his wisdom has struck the proud one.

13.text: His spirit hath adorned the heavens, and his obstetric hand brought forth the winding serpent.

14.text: Lo, these things are said in part of his ways: and seeing we have heard scarce a little drop of his word, who shall be able to behold the thunder of his greatness?
